articles.title: My Jewish studies students aren’t talking about Israel or antisemitism. They told me why.
articles.description: (JTA) — I first noticed something was off on the first day of class. I had given my students in my “Sociology of American Jewish life” course at Tulane University blank index cards, asking them to write five words they associate with American Jews. The word antisemitism didn’t appear once, and neither did Israel. Last... The post My Jewish studies students aren’t talking about Israel or antisemitism. They told me why. appeared first on The Forward .
articles.author: Ilana M. Horwitz

articles.title: Northwestern can legally block enrollment for students who boycotted antisemitism training, federal judge says
articles.description: (JTA) — A federal judge in Chicago allowed Northwestern University to discipline students who refused to watch an antisemitism training video. Judge Georgia Alexakis declined Monday to issue a restraining order in a lawsuit filed by Northwestern Graduate Workers for Palestine and two graduate students. The plaintiffs claimed that an antisemitism training required by the... The post Northwestern can legally block enrollment for students who boycotted antisemitism training, federal judge says appeared first on The Forward .
articles.author: Grace Gilson

articles.title: Yiddish life in prewar Eastern Europe comes alive on this website
articles.description: On a quiet corner of the internet, a new website asks us to listen. That site — “https://www.yiddishculture.co/” — is more than a digital exhibit; it’s an act of cultural restitution. Each page restores the sound, movement and texture of Jewish life that once animated the streets of Poland and Lithuania, before silence fell. Yiddishculture.co.... The post Yiddish life in prewar Eastern Europe comes alive on this website appeared first on The Forward .
articles.author: Judah Sussman

articles.description: The American Association of University Professors (AAUP), the largest and oldest US organization for defending faculty rights, is picking a...
articles.author: Dion J. Pierre

articles.title: Brown University to Conduct ‘Campus Climate Survey’ Following Antisemitism Complaints
articles.description: Brown University will next week launch a “campus climate survey” to meet the conditions of an agreement it reached with...

articles.title: Judge: Northwestern can block enrollment for students resisting antisemitism training
articles.description: Georgia Alexakis rules plaintiffs' lawyers failed to prove discriminatory motive for university's requirement of antisemitism training video The post Judge: Northwestern can block enrollment for students resisting antisemitism training appeared first on The Times of Israel .

articles.title: Biblical tax notice: 1st-ever Assyrian inscription found near Jerusalem’s Temple Mount
articles.description: 2,700-year-old fragment of pottery suggests Judeans delayed paying their tributes to the empire, echoing the events described in the book of II Kings The post Biblical tax notice: 1st-ever Assyrian inscription found near Jerusalem’s Temple Mount appeared first on The Times of Israel .

articles.title: Federal judge allows Northwestern to block enrollment for students who boycotted antisemitism training
articles.description: Currently, 16 Northwestern students face enrollment holds for failing to complete the training. -- The post Federal judge allows Northwestern to block enrollment for students who boycotted antisemitism training appeared first on Jewish Telegraphic Agency .
articles.author: Grace Gilson

articles.title: Saul Rubinek’s new one-man show asks, Is there ever a right time to play Shylock?
articles.description: “Playing Shylock,” opening in Brooklyn, imagines the cancellation of Shakespeare’s controversial play about the humiliation of a Jewish moneylender. -- The post Saul Rubinek’s new one-man show asks, Is there ever a right time to play Shylock? appeared first on Jewish Telegraphic Agency .
articles.author: Andrew Silow-Carroll

articles.title: Trump admin reaches agreement with UVA, lauds ‘progress’ on Jew-hatred
articles.description: "DOJ can reopen anytime if UVA goes sideways. That's common sense and a fair deal," stated Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin. The post Trump admin reaches agreement with UVA, lauds ‘progress’ on Jew-hatred appeared first on JNS.org .

articles.title: Doctoral program admissions at Harvard down ‘significantly’ due to financial constraints
articles.description: “To balance both our academic and fiscal responsibilities, cohort sizes will be significantly reduced as we evaluate the future model for Ph.D. education,” the dean of Harvard’s arts and sciences faculty said. The post Doctoral program admissions at Harvard down ‘significantly’ due to financial constraints appeared first on JNS.org .

articles.title: 2,700-year-old Assyrian inscription unearthed near Temple Mount
articles.description: The inscription specifies a due date, and researchers are investigating the possibility that the artifact is evidence of a tax revolt, such as that of the biblical King Hezekiah against Sennacherib. The post 2,700-year-old Assyrian inscription unearthed near Temple Mount appeared first on JNS.org .
articles.author: JNS Staff

articles.title: Rabbis of LA | Rabbi Daniel Levine Wants to Have a ‘Civil Dialogue‘
articles.description: On his YouTube show, the 32-year-old San Diego native and professor at UC Irvine practices what he preaches. The post Rabbis of LA | Rabbi Daniel Levine Wants to Have a ‘Civil Dialogue‘ appeared first on Jewish Journal .
articles.author: Ari L. Noonan

articles.title: A Guide to Living Textually: Ilana Kurshan’s ‘Children of the Book’
articles.description: Throughout the memoir, Kurshan balances her love for Jewish texts and literature with raising her children. The post A Guide to Living Textually: Ilana Kurshan’s ‘Children of the Book’ appeared first on Jewish Journal .
articles.author: Na’amit Sturm Nagel

articles.title: Prestigious Israeli choreographer Ohad Naharin to lead special Gaga dance class 'for peace and justice'
articles.description: Ohad Naharin will hold a virtual class on Gaga, his globally renowned dance and pedagogy, where proceeds will support Standing Together, a Jewish-Arab grassroots peace group in Israel: 'It unites people – a real online community has formed, with people from the UAE, Iran, Lebanon and Egypt'
articles.author: Haaretz

articles.title: Gaza hostages developed coping mechanisms to help them survive captivity, new study shows
articles.description: After studying the testimonies of several dozen hostages who were released from captivity in Gaza, Prof. Inbar Levkovich insists that the struggle to return all of the deceased hostages is important for former captives, who see all of those who were in Gaza 'on a family level, like siblings'
articles.author: Adi Hashmonai

articles.title: She converted during COVID. Israeli immigration officials say her Zoom course doesn't count
articles.description: Facing rejection from Israel's Population and Immigration Authority, recent convert Isabella Vinci, supported by the Israel Religious Action Center, is preparing a court petition to challenge the decision, despite a Supreme Court ruling recognizing non-Orthodox conversions
articles.author: JTA

articles.title: Assyrian cuneiform hinting at tax dodging found in First Temple Jerusalem
articles.description: Sealing fragment from Assyria found in Jerusalem for the first time. Assyriologists believe it's a complaint.
articles.author: Ruth Schuster
